info.author: João Ferreira
info.description:
# hexdump_generator

-> Module to lazily hexdump a binary file, optionally applying compression, and derive a bytes object from a hexdump.

The goal was to be able to handle binary files of any size, without committing to I/O code, so that your program's
byte strings remain supported.

Here's an example:

    In [1]: import hexdump_generator.hexdump_gen as hg

    In [2]: binary_file = hg.read_binary_gen(r'hexdump_generator\tests\test_samples\test_file.bin')

    In [3]: gen = hg.compress_hexdump_gen(binary_file, addr=100, sep='|')

    In [4]: for i in gen: print(i)
